text: Hi.

I'm [INAUDIBLE],
and today, I'm going
to be talking about theano.

Theano is a Python library
developed at the Lisa Labs

at the University of Montreal to
define, optimize, and evaluate

mathematical expressions using
packages like NUMPY and SCIPY.

Let's take a deeper
dive into this.

The main goal of
theano is to support

rapid development of efficient
machine learning algorithms.

Though matrix
multiplication is mainly

done using the
NUMPY package, there

are some additional
benefits in theano

that is not directly available
in either Python or NUMPY.

Here are some additional
features of theano.
Execution speed optimizations.

Theano can compile parts
of your expression graph

into either CPU or
GPU instructions,

using the appropriate
compiler, making your code run
much faster than pure Python.

Efficient symbolic
differentiation

by automatically building
symbolic graphs for computing

gradients, speed and stability
optimizations by recognizing

numerically unstable
expressions and computing them

with more stable algorithms,
and dynamic C code

generation resulting in
faster expression evaluation.

All of these features, together
with extensive unit testing

and self verification, makes
theano an effective framework
for deep learning applications.

Theano also has many
functions and operations

which are particularly
useful for neural networks
and deep learning.

Some of these are
CONV operations

for convolutional
neural nets, NNET,

operations for neural
networks, and neighbors,

operations for working with
images in convolutional nets.

Intel optimized theano is a new
version based on theano 0.9.x,

which as optimized for Intel
architecture and enables

the Intel math
kernel library 2017.

The latest version
also of the Intel MKL

includes optimizations for
Intel advanced vector extensions

2, which is Intel AVX 2, and
AVX-512 instructions, which

are supported in Intel Xeon
and Intel Xeon 5 processors.

To improve performance,
we recommend

using the Intel
distribution of Python,

as it provides ready access
to tools and techniques which

are enabled and verified for
higher performance on Intel
architecture.

This will allow
the usage of Intel

optimized, precompiled
tools like NUMPY and SCIPY.
Thanks for watching.

You can download Intel's
software optimization

for theano from the GitHub
link in the description below.
